intro: Asplenium sarmentosum, commonly known as the creeping spleenwort, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Aspleniaceae. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on tree trunks or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has slender, creeping stems that produce small, lance-shaped leaves with a serrated margin. Its fronds are usually less than 10 centimeters in length and have a distinctive dark green color with a slightly glossy surface. Asplenium sarmentosum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich substrates.
